content.question: Great Zimbabwe is most similar to which of the following architectural works?

choices.label: The Great Mosque at Djenn√©, because of its conical forms and building materials
Mesa Verde cliff dwellings, because of its stone masonry and semi-sunken structures
Machu Picchu, because of its undulating stone masonry constructed without mortar
Chartres Cathedral, because of the use of an external buttressing technique

content.answer: Machu Picchu, because of its undulating stone masonry constructed without mortar

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe similarities and/or differences in two or more works of art using appropriate and relevant points of comparison.
